intro: Varronia limicola, commonly known as the marsh varronia, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Varronia limicola thrives in saline or brackish soils, making it an important component of coastal and marsh ecosystems. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
